casebody.data:
Jennifer L. WILSON
v.
SUNTRUST BANK; SunTrust Mortgage Inc.; Deutche Bank Trust Company Americas; The Law Firm of Hutchens, Senter & Britton, P.A. n/k/a Hutchens, Senter, Kellam & Pettit, P.A.; Substitute Trustee Services, Inc.; and Does/Janes 1-10 Inclusive No. 2P18 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2018 Julia B. Hartley, Attorney at Law, Ramona Farzad, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for SunTrust Bank, et al. Lacey Moore Duskin, Attorney at Law, for Hutchens Law Firm, LLP, et al. D. Kyle Deak, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Deutche Bank Trust Company Americas. Jennifer Lynn Wilson, for Wilson, Jennifer L.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by Plaintiff on the 3rd of January 2018 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30 (substantial constitutional question), the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the notice of appeal is

"Dismissed Ex Mero Motu by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 3rd of January 2018 by Plaintiff in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."
